text: [Trash]: The Corp cannot rez more than 1 piece of ice for the remainder of this run. Use this ability only during a run.
title: EMP Device

text:
When Diwan is installed, choose a server. As an additional cost to install a card in or protecting that server, the Corp must pay 1[Credits].
Trash Diwan if the Corp purges virus counters.
title: Diwan

text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, the Corp adds all cards in HQ to the top of R&D in the order of his or her choice. Designed by 2013 World Champion Jens Erickson
title: CBI Raid

flavor: "Why would you dispose of perfectly good evidence when you can sell it?"
text: Whenever you use a [Trash] ability, gain 1[Credits].
title: Tech Trader

text:
NetChip can host a program with a memory cost less than or equal to the number of copies of NetChip installed. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
Limit 6 per deck.
title: NetChip

flavor: "We may be outraged, but we’re not surprised." -Sunder
text: This card is not trashed until another current is played or an agenda is scored. The Corp has 1 additional bad publicity (even if they have 0).
title: Corporate Scandal

flavor: "The corporations may be stronger than any of us, but they are not stronger than all of us." -Akshara Sareen
text: Play only if you have at least 1 seedy card installed. The Corp has 1 fewer [Click] to spend on his or her next turn.
title: Populist Rally

text:
When you rez Advanced Assembly Lines, gain 3[Credits].
[Trash]: Install a non-agenda card from HQ (paying the install cost). You cannot use this ability during a run.
title: Advanced Assembly Lines

text: Whenever you rez a card, place 1 power counter on Lakshmi Smartfabrics. X hosted power counters: Reveal an agenda worth X points from HQ. The Runner cannot steal copies of that agenda for the remainder of this turn.
title: Lakshmi Smartfabrics

text: This card costs 0 influence if you have 6 or more non-alliance [haas-bioroid] cards in your deck. Trash a rezzed asset or upgrade. If you do, gain credits equal to its trash cost.
title: Product Recall

text: The first time each turn the Runner draws a card, gain 1[Credits].
title: Pālanā Foods: Sustainable Growth

flavor: Expensive to build but dramatically more efficient than traditional farming, agroplexes are emblems of the inevitable corporatization of the food industry.
text: When your turn begins, each player draws 1 card.
title: Pālanā Agroplex

flavor: "We can help others, yet also help ourselves." -Soraiya Suresh, VP Public Programs
text:
[Subroutine] The Runner draws 3 cards and then discards down to his or her maximum hand size.
[Subroutine] The Runner draws 3 cards and then discards down to his or her maximum hand size.
title: Harvester

flavor: Data, not food, is one of the biggest exports from the Gujarat district of Mumbad.
text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 2.
title: Remote Data Farm

text:
If Disposable HQ is accessed from R&D, the Runner must reveal it.
When the Runner accesses Disposable HQ, you may add any number of cards from HQ to the bottom of R&D.
title: Disposable HQ

text:
Install New Construction faceup.
Whenever you advance New Construction, you may install a card from HQ in a new server (and rez that card ignoring all costs if there are 5 or more advancement tokens on New Construction).
title: New Construction

text:
When your turn begins, place 1 advancement token on Mumbad Construction Co.
2[Credits]: Move 1 advancement token from Mumbad Construction Co. to a faceup card.
title: Mumbad Construction Co.

flavor: "You got it. We sell it. They buy it. Everyone wins."
text:
When you score Corporate Sales Team, place 10[Credits] on it.
When each player's turn begins, take 1[Credits] from Corporate Sales Team.
title: Corporate Sales Team

text:
This card costs 0 influence if you have 3 PAD Campaigns in your deck.
[Click]: Place 1 advancement token on a card. You cannot score that card until your next turn begins.
title: PAD Factory
